text: hey does vscode have a hubl language pack or anything that isn’t just grey text?
We do now! Give <https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=HubSpot.hubl> as spin and let us know what you think.

Oh, wow — this was a use case that we didn't anticipate. We have been making the assumption that a person would always be using `hs create` and that it wouldn't be used in scripts. Do you have some info on what kind of experience you were trying to create?

I’m using prompts in gulp to ask questions about type, name, and path, then generate the `hs create` command with that data.  It’s been working fine until I updated, and `hs create` now has its own additional prompts. What would be great is if there was either :
1.) a flag to tell it to use default values and execute like it used to instead of prompting, like:
`hs create module "myModule" "src/modules" --use-defaults`
or 2.) a set of flags that lets you specify the all answers to the prompts you’re asking directly in the initial command, so that it can still execute without further input.
`hs create module "myModule" "src/modules" --label="My Module" --content-type="Page" --global-module=true`

That’s actually how I’m using all the hs cli commands, executing through gulp—we gain a lot of efficiency with gulp using pick lists and reusing values throughout the tasks. I wonder though, if there is a more “pure javascripty” way of executing these commands instead of executing as a child process?
For a lot of stuff there is via <https://www.npmjs.com/package/@HubSpot/cms-lib> but we haven't documented it.
